message:
In order to increase the participation of KGPians in open source competitions like Google Summer of Code, Outreachy et al, Kharagpur Open Source Society has come up with a month long program called KWoC to help students prepare for such events.

Kharagpur Winter of Code or KWoC is a month long program wherin students will be introduced to the world of open source, and trained to contribute to it.Ex-GSoCers and other leading open source contributors would serve as their mentors in this quest.

Go to http://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in/ to register for the program as a student or submit your own project.

The countdown's over. Time for the big release of #KWOC!

As the semester is about to end, we are here with something you can make good use of, in your December vacations, we call it Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC). It is a December long online program. For those who already know about Google Summer of Code, KWoC is going to be very helpful for you. Register yourself as student and the instructions will follow you. For those who don't know about such open source programs, KWoC is a platform where you are going to learn about a new style of collaborative software development.

So, take some time and visit 

http://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in 

and register yourself.

Happy endsems!

- KOSS

What if you get stuck with a terrible GitHub username? Changing it might cost you all of your contributions! KOSS member Nitin Choudhary writes about a smart way to migrate all of your past contributions to a new GitHub username in his blog post titled "History-rewriter". Check it out!

#Github #Handle #Username

Hello people!

Google is interested in conducting an Applied CS with Android workshop at IIT Kharagpur. This is a great opportunity for everyone interested in improving on algorithmic skills and data structures. Learn and practice complex concepts like Dynamic Programming and Graph algorithms while making android games in the workshop. Additionally, successful participants with get certified by Google as an android developer.
As a first step, fill out this survey to let us know that you are interested. Choose your preferred dates, and let us know about your experience and skill set so that the workshop is organised in the best possible way! 
Stay tuned for more updates. 

https://goo.gl/forms/LH4ShNmA7rYASEN93

For more information, email us at appliedcs.iitkgp@gmail.com, or contact : Smruti Ranjan(08609289280), Ayushi Mrigen(07872841662)

The first computer to sing vocals!

In 1961, the IBM 7094 became the first computer to sing, singing the song Daisy Bell. Vocals were programmed by John Kelly and Carol Lockbaum and the accompaniment was programmed by Max Mathews. This performance was the inspiration for a similar scene in 2001: A Space Odyssey.

#CoolFacts #Computers #CodingLove

The first computer to sing vocals!

In 1961, the IBM 7094 became the first computer to sing, singing the song Daisy Bell. Vocals were programmed by John Kelly and Carol Lockbaum and the accompaniment was programmed by Max Mathews. This performance was the inspiration for a similar scene in 2001: A Space Odyssey.

#CoolFacts #Computers #CodingLove

Time for the first event of this session! As they say, any good open source developer worth his (or her) salt uses Linux. As a part of introducing awareness about Open Source in the campus, KOSS, in association with Metakgp and IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur, is organising the Ubuntu Install Fest. 

Date: 4th September, Sunday
Venue: Room 119 - CSE Department
Time - 2 to 6 pm.

Be there!

Note: Please bring a pendrive along with your laptop, and ensure there is enough charge for the installation to complete smoothly.

Written instructions: https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/How_to_install_Ubuntu_as_Dual_Boot

An information session(via Hangout) is going to be conducted tomorrow for Google APAC 2017 University Test by Google. Here are the details:

What?

We are hosting an information session for students who haven’t had the experience (or opportunity) of working on the types of problems presented in the Google APAC 2017 University Test. We will discuss the following:

-  key data structures and algorithms
-  a sample problem from a previous contest
-  common mistakes that people make, and some practices to improve the performance
-  Q&A focusing on problem solving, preparations, etc.

When? Thursday, 25th August, 2016, at 7pm IST. 

Format: It will be a Hangout-on-air. You can view at 

Event page - http://goo.gl/CUHBQV 

YouTube page - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZgIqZvmhbKM 

Q&A: Questions can be asked via the Q&A app on the Event page. We encourage you to post them beforehand, but you can ask your questions during the live session as well.
